summary: The “Keeping Obstetrics Local Act” aims to improve maternal healthcare access and support. It enhances financial support for rural and safety net hospitals offering maternity services, mandates continuous coverage and health homes for pregnant individuals under Medicaid and CHIP, and invests in the maternal healthcare workforce. The bill also requires public notification of obstetric unit closures and comprehensive data collection related to labor and delivery services, striving to improve maternal healthcare access. It also includes provisions for streamlined enrollment and financial support for depression and anxiety screening.
